Questions.QuestionString: How many start bleed valves on PW1100G?
Which stage the start bleed valve install on?
Answers: 6th
7th
8th

Questions.QuestionString: The operating LP compressor stator vane actuator (LPC SVA), if there is a loss of electrical power?
Answers: The actuator positions vanes in the full close position for inhibited airflow through the LPC
The actuator positions vanes in the full open fail safe position for maximum airflow through the LPC
Neither A nor B

Questions.QuestionString: What is the purpose of the 2.5 Bleed valve actuator?
Answers: Control the LPC bleed valve through the 2.5 bleed valve linkage when commanded by EEC
Control the HPC bleed valve through the 2.5 bleed valve linkage when commanded by EEC
Control the LPT bleed valve through the 2.5 bleed valve linkage when commanded by EEC

Questions.QuestionString: Which is bleed air system used to improve engine startup performance?
Answers: The HPC Bleed air system bleeds 6th stage HPC air
The HPC Bleed air system bleeds 8th stage HPC air
The LPC Bleed air system bleeds 8th stage HPC air

Questions.QuestionString: At start, how are the HPC active and passive bleed valve operate?
Answers: Mechanically spring loaded (fail safe) open
Electrically control to close
Electrically control to open

Questions.QuestionString: How is Active clearance control valve operate?
Answers: During normal engine operation, the valve is closed at start and idle
Partially open at takeoff and climb, and fully open at cruise
Both answer are correct

Questions.QuestionString: Is the purpose of the Active Clearance Control (ACC) system?
Answers: To improve compressor efficiency
To improve and maintain engine performance
To reduce overall engine thermal growth

Questions.QuestionString: What is 5 major function of air system on PW1100G?
What is the fail safe position of 2.5 Bleed valve actuator?
Answers: Fully Close
Fully open
30% open

Questions.QuestionString: The HPC Stator Vane Actuator can control how many stage of HPC?
What is the purpose of Buffer air heat exchanger?
Answers: Provides discrete (on/off) control of HPC 3rd Stage bleed air supply to the Bearing Ventilation System
Use station 2.5 bleed air to cool HPC 3rd Stage Air before its delivery to the No.4 Bearing housing
Provide cooling buffer air to the engine main bearing compartment and prevent oil leakage

Questions.QuestionString: What is the purpose of LPBSOV - Low pressure buffer shutoff valve?
Answers: Provides discrete (on/off) control of HPC 3rd Stage servo pressure sent to the LPBSOV
Direct buffer air to the Bearing Ventilation System
Provides discrete (on/off) control of HPC 3rd Stage bleed air supply to the Bearing Ventilation System

Questions.QuestionString: How is the inlet cone anti-iced?
Answers: The inlet cone is not anti-iced at all
The inlet cone is anti-iced when engine anti-ice pushbutton is pushed on
The inlet cone is anti-iced with a continuous flow of 2.5 bleed air

Questions.QuestionString: The VVS (Variable Vanes System) actuators of LPC and HPC are:
Answers: Electrically controlled by EEC and actuated by servo fuel
Electrically controlled by EEC and actuated by P3 pneumatic motive air
Electrically controlled and actuated by EEC

Questions.QuestionString: The 2.5 bleed valve actuator commanded by the EEC and actuated:
Answers: By P3 pneumatic motive air
Electrical motor
Servo fuel

Questions.QuestionString: What is the fail-safe position of LPC Stator Vane System?
Answers: Full closed
Full open
Preselected partially open

Questions.QuestionString: What is the fail-safe position of 2.5 Bleed Valve?
Answers: Full closed
Full open
Preset partially open

Questions.QuestionString: How to improve engine startup performance by the HPC Air System?
Answers: By 2.5 bleed air valve
By two HPC bleed valves
By three HPC bleed valves

Questions.QuestionString: What is the function of HPC bleed valves?
Answers: Allow HPC 6th Stage air to bleed directly into the core compartment during engine start
Allow HPC 6th Stage air to bleed directly into fan flow during engine start
Allow HPC 3rd Stage air to bleed directly into the core compartment during engine start

Questions.QuestionString: How does EEC monitor the position of HPC bleed valves?
Answers: By thermocouple sensors
By pressure sensors
There is no position feedback to EEC

Questions.QuestionString: The ACC (Active Clearance Control) System uses fan air to:
Answers: Cool turbineâ€™s blades and vanes
Cool turbine cases to improve the fuel efficiency
Cool bearing compartments

Questions.QuestionString: What is the fail-safe mode of the ACC (Active Clearance Control) valve and actuator?
Answers: Closed
Full open
Partially open

Questions.QuestionString: 2.5 Stage Bleed Valve locates at:
Answers: Low Pressure Compressor
Compressor Intermediate Case
High Pressure Compressor

Questions.QuestionString: The engine inlet cone is anti-iced with
Answers: Continuous airflow from the 2.5 compressor stage
Continuous airflow from the 3 compressor stage
Continuous airflow from the 6 compressor stage

Questions.QuestionString: A single stage Variable Inlet Guide Vanes (VIGVs) which direct the air to the LP Compressor at the correct angle and
Answers: Are controlled by the PHMU
Are controlled by the EEC
Are not controlled by the EEC

Questions.QuestionString: No.4 bearing compartment is cooled and sealing by:
Answers: Buffer air (HPC 3rd stage air cooled by 2.5 bleed air)
Buffer air (HPC 3rd stage air cooled by fan air)
Buffer air (2.5 bleed air cooled by fan air)

Questions.QuestionString: To maintain the proper air pressure at bearing compartment Nos. 1, 2, 3, and 5/6 for carbon seals:
Answers: HPC 3rd Stage air is supplied to achieve the function
2.5 bleed air is used for this function
Depending on power setting 2.5 bleed air or HPC 3rd stage air is used for bearing compartments sealing/pressurizing
